column4: Is there any Nice little Application thats Easy to use (unlike Conky) that Allows me to place a Ram / Cpu Usage Monitor + Time + other small things, e.g. Songs playing etc. on my Desktop, the way conky does? if no, can someone tell me where to place the conkyr file?
theres hundereds of conky scripts/examples at the conky home page you can use/alter as you want.  Or try gkrellm (i think i spelt that riught)
ask and see. :)  if nothing else i can point ya to the faq hat has the answer.
Did you see my question? :)
the conky command can generate a 'default' config, or the conky homapage has them you can download.
or checkthe contents of the conky packatge to see what it installed where..
When i type Conky in terminal, i only get "Bus Error"
or use 'locate conky' to see what it insalled where also
you dont see conky on the desktop?
No i do not see it.
odd.. it works here.. rather ugly default settings also.
conky --print-config >  conkyconfig

What do u think i should do :-/?, i've been trying all day long to search inet for this, with nothing, Things that are going wrong: The Conky file isnt there -> and Conky in terminal gives me bus error.
Should i write that in terminal yes?
make a config and tweak it.. or try some simple example configs. No idwa what the buss error is about
When i type that in Terminal, i only get "bus Error" back
no idea on that then. You got some deeper issues going on. did itmake the file at all?
conky --print-config
theres a config file in --> /etc/conky/conky.conf
Should i Edit That file with the "Code" That i want ( I got one standing by on a website :) )
take the config ya want to use put in .conkyrc
then tell conk to use the config
MAKE it.
How do i make it execute from the file i just Created?
